newsitem.title: JAPAN: KDD in talks with Thai telecom firm on cell phones.
newsitem.headline: KDD in talks with Thai telecom firm on cell phones.

text.p: Japanese international telecommunications firm Kokusai Denshin Denwa Co Ltd (KDD) said on Friday it was negotiating with state-owned Telephone Organisation of Thailand over a possible tie-up in the personal handyphone system (PHS) business in Bangkok.
A KDD spokeswoman, however, declined to comment further on the tie-up, saying that the two sides were still in negotiations.
The PHS is a Japan-developed mobile phone which can be used only in a limited area but is cheaper than conventional mobile phones.

The Japanese business daily Nihon Keizai Shimbun reported on Friday that KDD and the Thai firm had agreed to set up a joint venture for the PHS project, aiming to get approval from the Thai government by early 1997.
KDD is planning to start the PHS business in other parts of Southeast Asia, the paper said.
